member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.BulkPublishRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the BulkPublish operation. Initiates a bulk publish of all existing datasets for an Identity Pool to the configured stream. Customers are limited to one successful bulk publish per 24 hours. Bulk publish is an asynchronous request, customers can see the status of the request via the GetBulkPublishDetails operation.
This API can only be called with developer credentials. You cannot call this API with the temporary user credentials provided by Cognito Identity.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.BulkPublishRequest.IdentityPoolId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IdentityPoolId. A name-spaced GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.BulkPublishResponse
member.summary: The output for the BulkPublish operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.BulkPublishResponse.IdentityPoolId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IdentityPoolId. A name-spaced GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.CognitoStreams
member.summary: Configuration options for configure Cognito streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.CognitoStreams.RoleArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RoleArn. The ARN of the role Amazon Cognito can assume in order to publish to the stream. This role must grant access to Amazon Cognito (cognito-sync) to invoke PutRecord on your Cognito stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.CognitoStreams.StreamingStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamingStatus. Status of the Cognito streams. Valid values are:
ENABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is enabled.
DISABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is disabled. Bulk publish will also fail if StreamingStatus is DISABLED.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.CognitoStreams.StreamName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property StreamName. The name of the Cognito stream to receive updates. This stream must be in the developers account and in the same region as the identity pool.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.Dataset
member.summary: A collection of data for an identity pool. An identity pool can have multiple datasets. A dataset is per identity and can be general or associated with a particular entity in an application (like a saved game). Datasets are automatically created if they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value pairs.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.Dataset.CreationDate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CreationDate. Date on which the dataset was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.Dataset.DatasetName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DatasetName. A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.Dataset.DataStorage
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DataStorage. Total size in bytes of the records in this dataset.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.Dataset.IdentityId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IdentityId. A name-spaced GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.Dataset.LastModifiedBy
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LastModifiedBy. The device that made the last change to this dataset.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.Dataset.LastModifiedDate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LastModifiedDate. Date when the dataset was last modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.Dataset.NumRecords
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NumRecords. Number of records in this dataset.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DeleteDatasetRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteDataset operation. Deletes the specific dataset. The dataset will be deleted permanently, and the action can't be undone. Datasets that this dataset was merged with will no longer report the merge. Any subsequent operation on this dataset will result in a ResourceNotFoundException.
This API can be called with temporary user credentials provided by Cognito Identity or with developer credentials.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DeleteDatasetRequest.DatasetName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DatasetName. A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DeleteDatasetRequest.IdentityId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IdentityId. A name-spaced GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DeleteDatasetRequest.IdentityPoolId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IdentityPoolId. A name-spaced GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DeleteDatasetResponse
member.summary: Response to a successful DeleteDataset request.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DeleteDatasetResponse.Dataset
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Dataset. A collection of data for an identity pool. An identity pool can have multiple datasets. A dataset is per identity and can be general or associated with a particular entity in an application (like a saved game). Datasets are automatically created if they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value pairs.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DescribeDatasetRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeDataset operation. Gets meta data about a dataset by identity and dataset name. With Amazon Cognito Sync, each identity has access only to its own data. Thus, the credentials used to make this API call need to have access to the identity data.
This API can be called with temporary user credentials provided by Cognito Identity or with developer credentials. You should use Cognito Identity credentials to make this API call.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DescribeDatasetRequest.DatasetName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DatasetName. A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DescribeDatasetRequest.IdentityId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IdentityId. A name-spaced GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DescribeDatasetRequest.IdentityPoolId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IdentityPoolId. A name-spaced GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DescribeDatasetResponse
member.summary: Response to a successful DescribeDataset request.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.DescribeDatasetResponse.Dataset
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Dataset. Meta data for a collection of data for an identity. An identity can have multiple datasets. A dataset can be general or associated with a particular entity in an application (like a saved game). Datasets are automatically created if they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value pairs.

member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetBulkPublishDetails operation. Get the status of the last BulkPublish operation for an identity pool.
This API can only be called with developer credentials. You cannot call this API with the temporary user credentials provided by Cognito Identity.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property IdentityPoolId. A name-spaced GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse.BulkPublishCompleteTime
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BulkPublishCompleteTime. If BulkPublishStatus is SUCCEEDED, the time the last bulk publish operation completed.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse.BulkPublishStartTime
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BulkPublishStartTime. The date/time at which the last bulk publish was initiated.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse.BulkPublishStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BulkPublishStatus. Status of the last bulk publish operation, valid values are:
NOT_STARTED - No bulk publish has been requested for this identity pool
IN_PROGRESS - Data is being published to the configured stream
SUCCEEDED - All data for the identity pool has been published to the configured stream
FAILED - Some portion of the data has failed to publish, check FailureMessage for the cause.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse.FailureMessage
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FailureMessage. If BulkPublishStatus is FAILED this field will contain the error message that caused the bulk publish to fail.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.ListDatasetsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListDatasets operation. Lists datasets for an identity. With Amazon Cognito Sync, each identity has access only to its own data. Thus, the credentials used to make this API call need to have access to the identity data.
ListDatasets can be called with temporary user credentials provided by Cognito Identity or with developer credentials. You should use the Cognito Identity credentials to make this API call.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.ListRecordsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListRecords operation. Gets paginated records, optionally changed after a particular sync count for a dataset and identity. With Amazon Cognito Sync, each identity has access only to its own data. Thus, the credentials used to make this API call need to have access to the identity data.
ListRecords can be called with temporary user credentials provided by Cognito Identity or with developer credentials. You should use Cognito Identity credentials to make this API call.

Other key/values pairs are not updated. To remove a key value pair, pass a empty value for the particular key.
This API can only be called with developer credentials. You cannot call this API with the temporary user credentials provided by Cognito Identity.

Gets and sets the property IdentityPoolId.
A name-spaced GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. The ID of the pool to which this identity belongs.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse
member.summary: Response to an UnsubscribeFromDataset request.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.UpdateRecordsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateRecords operation. Posts updates to records and adds and deletes records for a dataset and user.
The sync count in the record patch is your last known sync count for that record. The server will reject an UpdateRecords request with a ResourceConflictException if you try to patch a record with a new value but a stale sync count.
For example, if the sync count on the server is 5 for a key called highScore and you try and submit a new highScore with sync count of 4, the request will be rejected. To obtain the current sync count for a record, call ListRecords. On a successful update of the record, the response returns the new sync count for that record. You should present that sync count the next time you try to update that same record. When the record does not exist, specify the sync count as 0.
This API can be called with temporary user credentials provided by Cognito Identity or with developer credentials.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.UpdateRecordsRequest.ClientContext
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ClientContext. Intended to supply a device ID that will populate the lastModifiedBy field referenced in other methods. The ClientContext field is not yet implemented.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.UpdateRecordsRequest.DatasetName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DatasetName. A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.UpdateRecordsRequest.DeviceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeviceId.
The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.UpdateRecordsRequest.IdentityId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IdentityId. A name-spaced GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.UpdateRecordsRequest.IdentityPoolId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IdentityPoolId. A name-spaced GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.UpdateRecordsRequest.RecordPatches
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RecordPatches. A list of patch operations.

member.name: P:Amazon.CognitoSync.Model.UpdateRecordsRequest.SyncSessionToken
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SyncSessionToken. The SyncSessionToken returned by a previous call to ListRecords for this dataset and identity.

member.name: T:Amazon.CognitoSync.AmazonCognitoSyncClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing CognitoSync
Amazon Cognito Sync
Amazon Cognito Sync provides an AWS service and client library that enable cross-device syncing of application-related user data. High-level client libraries are available for both iOS and Android. You can use these libraries to persist data locally so that it's available even if the device is offline. Developer credentials don't need to be stored on the mobile device to access the service. You can use Amazon Cognito to obtain a normalized user ID and credentials. User data is persisted in a dataset that can store up to 1 MB of key-value pairs, and you can have up to 20 datasets per user identity.
With Amazon Cognito Sync, the data stored for each identity is accessible only to credentials assigned to that identity. In order to use the Cognito Sync service, you need to make API calls using credentials retrieved with Amazon Cognito Identity service.
If you want to use Cognito Sync in an Android or iOS application, you will probably want to make API calls via the AWS Mobile SDK. To learn more, see the Developer Guide for Android and the Developer Guide for iOS.
